title: Stabbed Chelsea fan shocked by Naples attack
byline: A Chelsea supporter has described his ’’shock’’ after being stabbed and taken to hospital before Wednesday’s Champions League match against Napoli in Italy.

title: Sri Lanka face must-win U19 World Cup Clash as Semi-Final Race Heats Up
byline: Sri Lanka’s Under-19 team will face South Africa in a crucial Super Six clash today, with their semi-final hopes still alive in the ICC Under-19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026.

title: Rohan Olugala appointed Director of Walana Anti-Corruption Unit
byline: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Rohan Olugala has been appointed as the new director of the Walana Anti-Corruption Unit.

title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
byline: China has executed 11 members of a notorious family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

title: Stephanie appointed to PO Committee due to social service work: Spokesman
byline: The Government has appointed a six-member Prison Observation Committee with the objective of identifying issues faced by prison detainees and carrying out welfare-related activities.

title: SL to spend $1.5 bn on vehicles in 2026
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank, Dr Nandalal Weerasinghe, said Sri Lanka spent around US$2.0 billion on vehicle imports in 2025 and could spend a further US$1.5 billion in 2026 as pent-up demand wanes.

title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
byline: A passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, the country’s state-run airline Satena confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka unveils national anti-human trafficking plan
byline: The National Anti-Human Trafficking Task Force (NAHTTF) officially launched the National Strategic Action Plan to Monitor and Combat Human Trafficking (2026–2030), reaffirming Sri Lanka’s strong commitment to eliminating all forms of human trafficking and strengthening coordinated national responses.

title: CB keeps policy rate unchanged at 7.75% as inflation outlook holds
byline: The Central Bank yesterday left its key policy rate, the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR), unchanged at 7.75 percent, while signalling an accommodative monetary stance, as the Monetary Policy Board is of the view the current policy setting is appropriate to steer inflation towards its medium-term target of around 5 percent.

title: Foreign investments important but forex flows remain priority: CB Governor
byline: Foreign exchange earnings are more critical to Sri Lanka’s macroeconomic stability than foreign investments, Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said addressing the first Monetary Policy Review for 2026.

title: Special traffic plan announced for Gangaramaya Navam Perahera
byline: Police have announced a special traffic plan in Colombo in view of the annual Navam Maha Perahera of the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple.

title: Filling stations apologise to customers over reduced discounts
byline: Filling stations attached to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) have displayed apology banners at outlets across the country, citing reduced discounts as the reason for operational difficulties.

title: CBSL probes 18 over illegal plantation investment schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) is investigating 18 institutions and individuals allegedly involved in illegal deposit-taking from the public under the guise of forest and plantation-based investment schemes, Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said yesterday.

title: Court awaits AG’s advice in NR Consultation case against Namal
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today sent a reminder to the Attorney General to expedite his legal advice regarding a plaint filed against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa and four others for their alleged involvement in money laundering amounting to Rs.15 million in a company allegedly owned by Namal Rajapaksa.

title: No need for unnecessary fear over Nipah virus: Health Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni yesterday assured the public that there is no threat to Sri Lanka from the Nipah virus currently reported in parts of India, stressing that no cases have been detected in the country so far.

title: Children under 15 among 12% of annual leprosy cases
byline: Sri Lanka reports 1,500–2,000 leprosy cases annually, with about 12% affecting children under the age of 15, health authorities said today. Moratuwa has recorded the highest number of pediatric cases in recent years, according to officials.

title: Sri Lanka scrambles to protect rubber trade ahead of EU forest rules
byline: Sri Lanka is working hard to protect its rubber products exports to the markets in the European Union to avoid any impact from the EU Deforestation Regulation which will come into effect next year, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Gold rockets past US$5,500 as global uncertainties mount
byline: Gold extended its blistering rally on Jan 29, rocketing past US$5,500 per ounce for the first time as investors sought safety amid deepening economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

title: Patients caught in doctors–Health Ministry tug of war
byline: Patients were caught in the middle as disruptions to government hospital services continued for a fourth day amid ongoing tensions between doctors and health authorities.

title: Are children in Sri Lanka safe?
byline: Violence and sexual abuse against children still remain a key problem highlighting that Sri Lanka is yet to be on a path that ensure a safe future for children. A total of 10455 offences have been recorded for the year of 2025 which include rape, Grave Sexual Abuse, Obscene Publications and Cyber Bulling (threatening using nude photos), according to the National Child Protection Authority.

title: 15-Year-old girl missing from detention centre
byline: The Kuliyapitiya Police are seeking public assistance to locate a 15-year-old girl who has gone missing from a government detention centre in Meegahakotuwa.

title: Ancient Sinhala Vihare emerges from Lake Island in Andra Pradesh
byline: Surrounded by forested mountains in Andra Pradesh in India just across the border of the Telangana state, what lies  is the   world’s third biggest man- made  reservoir called Nagarjunasagar .  The expansive  lake is now bound to be an appeal for Sri Lankan Buddhists since the island sitting in it hosts the ruins of  what is called ’ancient Sinhala Vihare’ built during the third century AD by Mahayana Buddhist philosopher Nagarjuna Acharya.

title: Sri Lankan detainee’s death could have been prevented 3 times: Doctor
byline: Sri Lankan detainee Wishma Sandamali’s life could have been saved at three different times before she died at an immigration facility in Japan in 2021, a doctor said in a court hearing on Wednesday.

title: Court upholds 10 years sentence on Pastor for rape of minor
byline: The Court of Appeal upheld a sentence of 10 years of rigorous imprisonment imposed on a Pastor attached to a church at Kottukachchi in the Puttalam District, for raping a 15-year-old girl after developing an acquaintance with her and subsequently inviting her to serve god.

title: EC calls for applications from political parties for 2026 recognition
byline: The Election Commission has called for applications from political parties eligible for official recognition in 2026.

title: Nalandians take to social media to clear school’s name
byline: A group of past and present students of Nalanda College have taken to social media to defend the reputation of the school following the circulation of controversial footage on social media.

title: UK’s Starmer signals China reset in talks with Xi, eyes economic wins
byline: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer told Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday that he wanted to build a ’’sophisticated relationship’’ with Beijing to bolster security and the economy, signalling a reset after years of strained ties.

title: Colombo Mayor supports Stephanie
byline: Colombo Mayor Vraie Cally Balthazaar, who came out in defense of Stephanie Siriwardhana following her appointment to the six-member Prison Observation Committee, said women like herself must speak louder and more clearly against bullying on social media.

title: Plans afoot to establish National Film School
byline: Plans are afoot to establish a National Film School in Sri Lanka by utilising existing resources of the Sri Lanka Foundation, which operates under the Ministry of Mass Media and the National Film Corporation.

title: Do not ignore Nipah risk, pay attention to foreign tourists: Dr. Chamal
byline: Medical and civil rights expert Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa has urged Sri Lankan health authorities to closely monitor the Nipah virus situation reported in several Asian countries, including India, and to take precautionary measures focusing on foreign arrivals to the country.

title: Nipah risk to Sri Lanka ‘Very Low’ amid regional cases, Health Ministry says
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Anil Jasinghe, has reassured the public that the risk of the Nipah virus spreading to Sri Lanka is very low.

title: IMF Managing Director to visit Sri Lanka next month
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) will send its Managing Director, Kristalina Georgieva, to Sri Lanka next month to review the country’s economic reform program and to demonstrate the Fund’s solidarity following recent natural disasters, IMF Asia and Pacific Department Director Krishna Srinivasan said.

title: US Embassy condoles death of Sri Lanka Navy Lt. Koyan Chamitha
byline: The United States Embassy in Sri Lanka has expressed its condolences over the passing of Sri Lanka Navy Lieutenant Koyan Chamitha.

title: Colombo market extends decline as sentiment remains subdued
byline: The Colombo stock market closed on a negative note on Thursday, with both benchmark indices ending the session in the red, as investor sentiment remained cautious amid the ongoing consolidation phase.

title: Government to upgrade preschools ahead of 2027 policy implementation: Minister Paulraj
byline: Plans underway to enhance the quality of early childhood education across the country ahead of the 2027 rollout of the National Policy on Preschool Education, Women and Child Affairs Minister Saroja Savitri Paulraj said.

title: Sajith visits HMGICS Singapore
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa visited the Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre, Singapore (HMGICS) during his current tour to Singapore. Premadasa said the visit to HMGICS Singapore was a part of a fact-finding mission.

title: Court summons me, won’t hide Govt scams: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa today dismissed attempts to summon him before court, claiming they are part of a cover-up of government scandals, including the coal and container scams.

title: SLPP denies social media rumors on Rajitha Hiran’s political appointment
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has denied reports claiming that actor Rajitha Hiran, popularly known as Ping Pong, has been appointed as the party’s organizer for the Kesbewa constituency.

title: Businessman arrested for aiding and abetting money laundering
byline: A businessman has been arrested on charges of aiding and abetting money laundering, following an investigation conducted by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Sri Lanka battles with rising cancer patients as daily deaths rise to 40
byline: Sri Lanka is facing a silent epidemic as around 100 new cancer patients are diagnosed every day and nearly 40 succumb to the disease, with experts warning that lifestyle choices and environmental hazards are fueling the crisis.

title: Mano Ganesan says Ditwah disaster exposes marginalisation of Malaiyaha community
byline: Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) Leader and MP Mano Ganesan said the Ditwah disaster has once again highlighted Sri Lanka’s vulnerability to climate-related crises and the long-standing marginalisation of the Malaiyaha Tamil community in disaster relief, resettlement, and protection.

title: No child’s education will depend on parents’ wealth; PM vows equal future for every child
byline: The government will never allow a child’s education to be determined by the financial capacity of parents, stressing that safeguarding every child’s future is a fundamental responsibility of the State, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.
